result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaucinda R Tierson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to defendant - case was read in & dismissed.

Cases 15CM59, 15CM161 and 15CM163 called together at 10:06am 
Defendant Jaucinda R Tierson in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CM161 Counts #1 and #3 and Case 15CM163 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified in all cases; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses:  Case 15CM59 and all remaining counts of 15CM161 and 15CM163

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Ms. Tierson makes statement 

On Case 15CM161 Counts #1 and #3 and Case 15CM163 Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--random drug and/ or alcohol screening at the discretion of the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--anger management and/ or criminal thinking course at the discretion of the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--submit a DNA sample to designee/Sheriff upon demand
--Case 15CM161 Count #1:to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--Case 15CM161 Count #3:to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $50 Drug Testing Fee
--Case 15CM163 Count #1:to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Violence surcharge

Case 15CM161: Days credit for time already served:  18  days
Case 15CM163: Days credit for time already served:  19  days

The Court informs Ms. Tierson that she has the right to request expungement of DNA sample. 
recess: 10:41am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 09:40 am.

[MK] case called at 2:01pm. 
Defendant Jaucinda R Tierson in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
After reviewing the Criminal Complaint and noting that Jennifer Farmer is referenced in the Complaint, the Court discloses that Jennifer Farmer appeared in this Court on a regular basis when this Court had the General Court-assignment under the Judicial Rotation. The Court feels no need to recuse.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense
recess 2:05pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/20/15 at 9:40am,  (2)  Status Conference on 6/15/15 at 3:00pm
CLERKS NOTE: The defendant called the COC office and advised she has been released from rehab. The address on the criminal complaint in Watertown is correct.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:55pm. 
Defendant Jaucinda R Tierson in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  Ms. Tierson indicates that she spoke with Attorney De La Rosa earlier today, and that Attorney De La Rosa told her that he will mail her application paperwork for this. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.
Ms. Tierson indicates that she is entering in-patient treatment tomorrow; this program will last approximately 45 days. 

The Court continues the $150 cash bond (already posted) , with added conditions: 
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--if Ms. Tierson discharges herself or is removed early from the intended drug and alcohol program in Green Bay that is commencing tomorrow, then Ms. Tierson is to notify the Clerk of Courts Office of this within 48 hours of leaving the treatment, so that the Court can consider rescheduling the Adjourned Initial Appearance to an earlier date.  
recess 2:59pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/5/15 at 2:00pm.
